clips.what_happens_visually: Michael makes exaggerated eye contact while saying "I'll kill you". Toby looks concerned. Michael's eyes widen.
clips.meme_caption:
When the intern asks
if you're using AI
clips.why_it_works: The extreme close-up combined with the absurdly threatening line creates a perfect visual for startup anxieties.

clips.what_happens_visually: Toby opens a gift to find a rock with a post-it note saying "Suck on this". He looks confused and slightly hurt.
clips.meme_caption:
POV: Your seed round
term sheet
clips.why_it_works: The juxtaposition of a gift with a rude message perfectly captures the painful reality of fundraising.

clips.what_happens_visually: Oscar explains that Ryan double-booked sales to inflate the website's performance. He then calls it "fraud".
clips.dialogue_hook: Which is what we refer to in the business as misleading the shareholders. Another good term is fraud.
clips.meme_caption:
Doubling your metrics
before the board meeting
clips.why_it_works: The dry delivery of 'fraud' makes this a darkly funny commentary on startup pressure.

clips.what_happens_visually: Jim says "Dwight, I'm really busy, I can't talk about this anymore." Dwight is seen removing a red wire from Jim's computer.
clips.dialogue_hook: Dwight I'm really busy, I can't talk about this anymore.
clips.meme_caption:
When the engineer
finds your prod key
clips.why_it_works: The escalating tension and Dwight's destructive actions are perfect for engineer humor.

clips.what_happens_visually: Pam asks Michael what his gift is for Toby. Michael pauses, then says "Yes, I am."
clips.meme_caption:
Interviewer: Are you
qualified for this role?
clips.why_it_works: The awkwardness and Michael's self-centeredness are relatable to the job search.

clips.what_happens_visually: Ryan holds up Michael's jeans and Pam says "Who dry cleans jeans?" then gives a speech about Michael loving how he looks in them.
clips.dialogue_hook:
Who dry cleans jeans?
Michael and his jeans...
clips.meme_caption:
Me: We need to cut
burn rate.
Also me: *dry cleans jeans*
clips.why_it_works: The absurdity of dry-cleaning jeans is a great metaphor for questionable startup spending.

clips.what_happens_visually: Kelly and Ryan announce their divorce. Andy is shocked and Ryan says "We are getting divorced, Andy. This is such a raw time."
clips.dialogue_hook: We are getting divorced, Andy. This is such a raw time.
clips.meme_caption:
When your co-founder
quits 2 weeks before demo
clips.why_it_works: The melodramatic delivery makes this a funny way to highlight the pain of a co-founder leaving.

clips.what_happens_visually: Michael drives a van and Ryan is in the back. Michael honks the horn and yells "Time to make the donuts!" Ryan is annoyed.
clips.why_it_works: The chaotic energy and Ryan's deadpan expression are relatable to engineers dealing with constant changes.
